content.title: OBC Pre Matric Scholarship-Uttar Pradesh
content.details: The Uttar Pradesh Social Welfare Department offers a Pre Matric Scholarship specifically designed to support Other Backward Class (OBC) students who are financially disadvantaged and pursuing secondary education in Class 9 or 10. This scholarship program recognizes the importance of education in empowering students from marginalized communities and aims to bridge the financial gap that might otherwise hinder their academic progress. By providing financial assistance, the scholarship helps alleviate the financial burden on SC families and encourages students to complete their matriculation, opening doors to further educational opportunities and brighter futures.
eligibility: Beneficiary must be a resident of Uttar Pradesh
Beneficiary must belong to the Other Backward Class (OBC) caste category
Beneficiaries who are dependents of people in occupations traditionally considered untouchable
Beneficiaries' parents' annual income should not be more than ₹2,00,000/-
All the children of the applicant's parents will be eligible
Students cannot receive other scholarships alongside this one (with some exceptions)
Beneficiary's age limit is 12 to 20 years old (as of July 1st)
documents_required: Mark sheet of your last qualifying examination
Bank passbook photocopy (where the scholarship amount will be deposited)

faqs.question: What is this scheme?
faqs.answer: The Uttar Pradesh Social Welfare Department offers a Pre Matric Scholarship for Other Backward Class (OBC) students. This scholarship aims to financially assist students from these categories to pursue secondary education and complete their matriculation.

faqs.question: How much financial benefits are provided?
faqs.answer: ₹150/- per month (for max 10 months). ₹750/- per annum (residential students).

faqs.question: Who can get the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: All eligible students from the resident of Uttar Pradesh can get the scheme benefits.

faqs.question: What is the caste eligibility criteria?
faqs.answer: Applicant must belong to the Other Backward Class (OBC) caste category.

faqs.question: What is educational eligibility criteria?
faqs.answer: Applicant must be studying in Class 9 or 10 in a recognized school.

faqs.question: What is financial eligibility criteria?
faqs.answer: Applicant family's annual income must not exceed ₹2,00,000/-.

faqs.question: What is the procedure to get the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: 1. The applicant will have to register himself online. 2. Fill out the application form. 3. Download the filled application form and submit it to the institute.

faqs.question: What documents are required?
faqs.answer: 1. Mark sheet of your last qualifying examination. 2. Caste certificate. 3. Income certificate of your family. 4. Bank passbook photocopy (where the scholarship amount will be deposited). 5. Fee receipt number (if applicable). 6. Enrollment number. 7. Aadhar card number. 8. Latest passport-sized photograph.

faqs.question: What is the official URL to get register and fill out application form?
faqs.answer: Follow the below URL. Link: https://scholarship.up.gov.in/
